intro: Bridelia scleroneura var. togoensis, commonly known as the Togo bridelia, is a shrub native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in local ecosystems and ethnobotanical practices.
